rawConfiguration.text:
**THE DETAILS IN THIS DASHBOARD ARE ESTIMATES, THE [DATA MANAGEMENT HUB](https://one.newrelic.com/launcher/data-management-nerdlets.data-management-launcher) SHOULD BE USED TO VIEW OFFICIAL INGESTION**

This page estimates the monthly ingest rates for various sources of Network Monitoring data including SNMP collection, API collection, network flow data, syslog data, VPC flow data, and the metrics and logs of the [ktranslate container](https://github.com/kentik/ktranslate) itself.

Controls include custom polling intervals, only collecting data from targeted interfaces, and reducing your sampling interval on your network and VPC flow data. The options are explained in [the docs](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/network-performance-monitoring/setup-performance-monitoring/advanced-config).

nrqlQueries.query:
SELECT
  latest(SNMP + API + Traps + KFlow + Syslog + VPC + Heartbeat + Health) AS 'TOTAL',
  latest(SNMP) AS 'SNMP POLLING',
  latest(Traps) AS 'SNMP TRAPS',
  latest(API) AS 'API POLLING',
  latest(KFlow) AS 'NETWORK FLOW DATA',
  latest(VPC) AS 'VPC FLOW DATA',
  latest(Syslog) AS 'SYSLOG DATA',
  latest(Heartbeat) AS 'KTRANSLATE METRICS',
  latest(Health) AS 'KTRANSLATE HEALTH LOGS'
FROM (
SELECT
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'kentik' AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks') AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic') AS 'SNMP',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'KSnmpTrap') AS 'Traps',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE (eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'kentik' AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks') AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic') OR eventType() = 'KExtEvent') AS 'API',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'KFlow') AS 'KFlow',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_AWS' OR eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_GCP') AS 'VPC',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND collector.name = 'ktranslate' AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog') AS 'Syslog',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik' AND instrumentation.name = 'heartbeat') AS 'Heartbeat',
  filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND collector.name = 'ktranslate' AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-health') AS 'Health'
FROM 
KExtEvent, KFlow, KSnmpTrap, Log, Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP, Metric)
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

SELECT
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'kentik' AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks') AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic') AS 'SNMP Polling',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE eventType() = 'KSnmpTrap') AS 'SNMP Traps',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE (eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'kentik' AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks') AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic') OR eventType() = 'KExtEvent') AS 'API Polling',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE eventType() = 'KFlow') AS 'Network Flows',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_AWS' OR eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_GCP') AS 'VPC Flows',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND collector.name = 'ktranslate' AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog') AS 'Syslog',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik' AND instrumentation.name = 'heartbeat') AS 'Health Metrics',
  filter(bytecountestimate(), WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND collector.name = 'ktranslate' AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-health') AS 'Health Logs'
FROM 
KExtEvent, KFlow, KSnmpTrap, Log, Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP, Metric
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
TIMESERIES
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric 
SELECT
  uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'Total Devices',
  rate(count(*), 1 second) AS 'Total SNMP Collections/Sec',
  count(*) AS 'Total SNMP Collections (Count)',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'Total GB',
  (bytecountestimate()/10e8) / uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'Avg GB/Device',
  bytecountestimate()/count(*) AS 'Avg Bytes/SNMP Collection'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

FROM Metric SELECT
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'GIGABYTE'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic'
FACET device_name AS 'DEVICE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

SELECT 
  ceiling(max(INTERFACES)/max(DEVICES)) AS 'AVG PHYSICAL INTERFACES',
  max(DAY) AS 'EST GB/DAY',
  max(MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FROM (
  FROM Metric SELECT
    uniqueCount(if_PhysAddress) AS 'INTERFACES',
    uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'DEVICES',
    bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'DAY',
    rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'MONTH'
  WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
  AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
  AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic'
  FACET entity.type)
FACET entity.type AS 'ENTITY TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric SELECT
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'DAY (GB)',
  rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'MONTH (GB)',
  uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index) AS 'INTERFACE COUNT',
  uniqueCount(objectIdentifier) AS 'OID COUNT'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic'
FACET device_name AS 'DEVICE', entity.type AS 'ENTITY TYPE', instrumentation.name AS 'PROVIDER PROFILE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric SELECT bytecountestimate()
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat', 'eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
AND provider != 'kentik-network-synthetic'
FACET entity.type, device_name
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

widgets.title: SNMP Trap Data Analysis - Last 24 Hours

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM KSnmpTrap SELECT 
  uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'Total Devices',
  rate(count(*), 1 second) AS 'Total Traps/Sec',
  count(*) AS 'Total Traps Collected',
  bytecountestimate()/count(*) AS 'Avg Bytes/Trap',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'Total GB',
  (bytecountestimate()/10e8) / uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'Avg GB/Device'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

FROM KSnmpTrap SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'GIGABYTE'
FACET entity.name AS 'DEVICE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM KSnmpTrap SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET TrapName, TrapOID
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM KSnmpTrap SELECT
uniqueCount(TrapOID) AS 'Unique Trap Types',
count(*) AS 'Total Traps',
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET device_name
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM KSnmpTrap SELECT
bytecountestimate()
FACET device_name
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

widgets.title: API Polling Data Analysis - Last 24 Hours

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric 
SELECT
  uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'Total API Endpoints',
  rate(count(*), 1 MINUTE) AS 'Total API Collections/Min',
  count(*) AS 'Total API Collections (Count)',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'Total GB',
  (bytecountestimate()/10e8) / uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'Avg GB/Endpoint',
  bytecountestimate()/count(*) AS 'Avg Bytes/API Collection'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

FROM Metric SELECT
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'GIGABYTE'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
FACET entity.name AS 'DEVICE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM Metric SELECT
  uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'TOTAL API ENDPOINTS',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
  rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
FACET aparse(instrumentation.name,'*.%') AS 'API TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric SELECT
  rate(count(*), 1 MINUTE) AS 'Total API Collections/Min',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
  rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
FACET entity.name AS 'ENDPOINT NAME', aparse(instrumentation.name,'*.%') AS 'API TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric SELECT
  bytecountestimate()
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name IN ('eapi.bgp', 'eapi.mlag', 'meraki.clients', 'meraki.uplinks')
FACET entity.name, aparse(instrumentation.name,'*.%')
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

FROM KFlow SELECT 
  uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'Total Devices',
  rate(count(*), 1 second) AS 'Total Flows/Sec',
  count(*) AS 'Total Flows Collected',
  bytecountestimate()/count(*) AS 'Avg Bytes/Flow',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'Total GB',
  (bytecountestimate()/10e8) / uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'Avg GB/Device'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

FROM KFlow SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'GIGABYTE'
FACET entity.name AS 'DEVICE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM KFlow SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET entity.type AS 'ENTITY TYPE', Type or type AS 'FLOW TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM KFlow SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'MONTH (GB)'
FACET entity.name AS 'DEVICE', Type or type AS 'FLOW TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM KFlow SELECT
bytecountestimate()
FACET entity.name, Type
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

widgets.title: VPC Flow Logs Analysis - Last 24 Hours

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP 
SELECT
  uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'Total VPCs',
  rate(count(*), 1 SECOND) AS 'Total VPC Flow Logs/Sec',
  count(*) AS 'Total VPC Flow Logs (Count)',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'Total GB',
  (bytecountestimate()/10e8) / uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'Avg GB/VPC',
  bytecountestimate()/count(*) AS 'Avg Bytes/VPC Flow Log'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

FROM Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP SELECT
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'GIGABYTE'
FACET jsonPayload.dest_vpc.vpc_name OR jsonPayload.src_vpc.vpc_name OR vpc_id AS 'VPC'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP SELECT
  uniqueCount(entity.guid) AS 'TOTAL VPC NETWORKS',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
  rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET CASES(WHERE eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_AWS' AS 'AWS', WHERE eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_GCP' AS 'GCP') AS 'VPC TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP SELECT
  count(*) AS 'TOTAL FLOW LOGS',
  rate(count(*), 1 SECOND) AS 'TOTAL FLOW LOGS/SEC',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
  rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET jsonPayload.dest_vpc.vpc_name OR jsonPayload.src_vpc.vpc_name OR vpc_id AS 'VPC NETWORK', CASES(WHERE eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_AWS' AS 'AWS', WHERE eventType() = 'Log_VPC_Flows_GCP' AS 'GCP') AS 'VPC TYPE'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Log_VPC_Flows_AWS, Log_VPC_Flows_GCP SELECT
  bytecountestimate()
FACET jsonPayload.dest_vpc.vpc_name OR jsonPayload.src_vpc.vpc_name OR vpc_id
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

FROM Log SELECT 
  uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'Total Devices',
  rate(count(*), 1 second) AS 'Total Syslog/Sec',
  count(*) AS 'Total Syslog Collected',
  bytecountestimate()/count(*) AS 'Avg Bytes/Syslog',
  bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'Total GB',
  (bytecountestimate()/10e8) / uniqueCount(device_name) AS 'Avg GB/Device'
WHERE collector.name = 'ktranslate'
AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO

FROM Log SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'GIGABYTE'
FACET device_name AS 'DEVICE'
WHERE collector.name = 'ktranslate'
AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM Log SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET CASES (
WHERE severity = 0 AS 'Emergency', 
WHERE severity = 1 AS 'Alert', 
WHERE severity = 2 AS 'Critical', 
WHERE severity = 3 AS 'Error', 
WHERE severity = 4 AS 'Warning', 
WHERE severity = 5 AS 'Notice', 
WHERE severity = 6 AS 'Informational', 
WHERE severity = 7 AS 'Debug' ) AS 'Severity'
WHERE collector.name = 'ktranslate'
AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Log SELECT
count(*) AS 'Total Messages',
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'EST GB/DAY',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'EST GB/MONTH'
FACET device_name
WHERE collector.name = 'ktranslate'
AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Log SELECT
bytecountestimate()
FACET device_name
WHERE collector.name = 'ktranslate'
AND plugin.type = 'ktranslate-syslog'
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

FROM Metric SELECT 
uniqueCount(objectIdentifier) AS 'OBJECT IDENTIFIERS' 
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat','netflow-events')
FACET `mib-name` AS 'MIB'
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric 
SELECT
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8,1 MONTH) AS 'MONTH'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat','netflow-events')
FACET `mib-name` AS 'MIB'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM Metric 
SELECT
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8,1 MONTH) AS 'MONTH'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat','netflow-events')
FACET `mib-name` AS 'MIB', capture(metricName, 'kentik.snmp.(?P<METRIC>.+)') AS 'METRIC NAME', objectIdentifier AS 'OID'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM Metric SELECT bytecountestimate()
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat','netflow-events')
FACET `mib-name` AS 'MIB', capture(metricName, 'kentik.snmp.(?P<METRIC>.+)') AS 'METRIC NAME'
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

rawConfiguration.text:
# Cardinality Analysis

## This page provides analysis of the top metrics from SNMP that are contributing to [Metric API cardinality limits](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/telemetry-data-platform/ingest-apis/metric-api/metric-api-limits-restricted-attributes/#additional-considerations) for your account. 

## You can follow the [troubleshooting guide in our documentation](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/data-apis/ingest-apis/metric-api/NRQL-high-cardinality-metrics) to help analyze the specific dimensions of the metric that are contributing the most volatility.

## Metric cardinality is best controlled through a combination of reducing your polling interval, limiting collection to only interfaces you need to monitor, and creating special [drop rules](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/telemetry-data-platform/manage-data/drop-data-using-nerdgraph/#drop-sensitive-data) for attributes that you don't need to collect.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric SELECT
cardinality() AS 'CARDINALITY'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat','netflow-events')
FACET capture(metricName, 'kentik.snmp.(?P<METRIC>.+)') AS 'METRIC NAME', objectIdentifier AS 'OID'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT 10

FROM Metric SELECT
cardinality() AS 'CARDINALITY'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'kentik'
AND instrumentation.name NOT IN ('heartbeat','netflow-events')
FACET capture(metricName, 'kentik.snmp.(?P<METRIC>.+)') AS 'METRIC NAME', objectIdentifier AS 'OID'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO TIMESERIES
LIMIT 10

FROM NrIntegrationError SELECT 
metricName AS 'METRIC NAME', 
limitValue AS 'CURRENT THRESHOLD', 
impactEndTime AS 'RESET TIME' 
WHERE category = 'RateLimit' 
AND rateLimitType = 'UniqueTimeseriesPerDay' 
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
LIMIT MAX

rawConfiguration.text:
# Most Likely Cardinality Violators

## The most common violation source for cardinality limits in SNMP monitoring is the `IF-MIB` and interface polling. There are classes of interfaces that do not provide actionable data and you should filter those out from your environment using the `match_attributes` rules in ktranslate as shown in the [documentation examples](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/network-performance-monitoring/advanced/advanced-config/#match_attributes-attribute).

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric 
SELECT filter(uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index), where if_interface_name like 'lo%') as 'Loopback Interfaces'
, filter(uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index), where if_interface_name like 'po%') as 'Port Channel Interfaces'
, filter(uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index), where if_interface_name like 'vl%') as 'VLAN Interfaces'
, filter(uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index), where if_interface_name like 'tu%') as 'Tunnel Interfaces'

FROM Metric 
SELECT uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index) AS 'Total Interfaces'
FACET CASES(
  WHERE if_Alias IS NULL OR if_Alias = '' AS 'No Alias', 
  WHERE if_Alias IS NOT NULL AND if_Alias != '' AS 'Has Alias')

FROM Metric 
SELECT uniqueCount(device_name, if_Index) AS 'Total'
FACET if_Alias
LIMIT 10

FROM Metric 
SELECT latest(tags.container_service) AS 'Container'
FACET device_name, if_interface_name, if_Alias
WHERE if_interface_name like 'lo%'
LIMIT MAX

widgets.title: List of Interfaces with No Alias

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric 
SELECT latest(tags.container_service) AS 'Container'
FACET device_name, if_interface_name, if_Alias
WHERE if_Alias is null
LIMIT MAX
